ranked_diseases.explanation: The elevated alkaline phosphatase and cortical thickening are key indicators. Proptosis and ptosis are also consistent with this condition.
The cortical thickening of the long bones, bone pain, and waddling gait resemble symptoms of this bone dysplasia.
Characterized by generalized skeletal sclerosis, including cortical thickening and narrowing of the medullary canal.
While not typically associated with hypocalcemia, the bone pain, elevated alkaline phosphatase, and hyperostosis can point towards Paget disease.
